title: Media Aesthetics
description: Analysis and interpretation of a specific media art or design movement, style, genre, or set of conventions in light of aesthetic, philosophical, and/or theoretical frameworks. Specific works and emphases may vary by year and instructor. Examples include video art of the 1970s and 80s, photographic strategies, media art and industry, media archaeology, and computational aesthetics. Program or materials fees may apply. Prerequisites: none.
